qas.question: Where do Northwestern's basketball, wrestling, and volleyball teams play?
What is the nickname given to Northwestern's athletic teams?
What was the official nickname of Northwestern's athletic teams prior to 1924?
What was the unofficial nickname of the Northwestern athletic teams prior to 1924?
What name did the student body unsuccessfully try to rename the Wildcats in 1972?
Where do Southwestern's basketball, wrestling, and volleyball teams play?
What is the nickname given to Southwestern's athletic teams?
What was the official nickname of Northwestern's athletic teams prior to 1922
What was the unofficial nickname of the Northwestern athletic teams prior to 1921?
What name did the student body unsuccessfully try to rename the Wildcats in 1970?

context: The football team plays at Ryan Field (formerly known as Dyche Stadium); the basketball, wrestling, and volleyball teams play at <a0_0><b5_0>Welsh-Ryan Arena<b5_0/><a0_0/>. Northwestern's athletic teams are nicknamed the <a1_0><b6_0>Wildcats<b6_0/><a1_0/>. Before 1924, they were known as "<a2_0>The <b7_0>Purple<b7_0/><a2_0/>" and unofficially as "<a3_0><b8_0>The Fighting Methodists<b8_0/><a3_0/>." The name Wildcats was bestowed upon the university in 1924 by Wallace Abbey, a writer for the Chicago Daily Tribune who wrote that even in a loss to the University of Chicago, "Football players had not come down from Evanston; wildcats would be a name better suited to [Coach Glenn] Thistletwaite's boys." The name was so popular that university board members made "wildcats" the official nickname just months later. In 1972, the student body voted to change the official nickname from "Wildcats" to "<a4_0><b9_0>Purple Haze<b9_0/><a4_0/>" but the new name never stuck.
